Data præprocessering

Indsæt Eksempel her

This is some code

Følgende klasser metoder er benyttet til præprocessering data af forskellige typer.

Klasser

class mlm.data_utils.data_prep_input_args.DataPrepArgParser

Class to handle input arguments for data preprocessing of scraped data – see RawScrapePreprocessing.

Parametre:

  • --danish_threshold (float) – Threshold to filter danish sentence predictions from raw scrape (default: 0.6)

  • --min_len (int) – Keep sentences with at least n words (default: 8)

  • --split (float) – training set size between 0 and 1 (default: 0.98)

  • --add_ppl (bool) – Whether to add ppl_score to unique sentences (default: False)

  • --ppl_threshold (int) – Perplexity threshold for approving sentences (default: 10000)

  • --train_outfile (str) – Name of final training data file fx ›train‹ (default: train)

  • --val_outfile (str) – Name of final validation data file fx ›validation‹ (default: validation)

  • --split_train_n_times (int) – Split train set n times into n+1 training sets (default: 0)

  • --excel_classification_file (str) – Name of annotated excel file (default: skrab_01.xlsx)

  • --classified_scrape_file (str) – Name of classified scrape file (default: classified_scrape)

  • --data_type (str) – ›unlabelled‹ or ›labelled‹ (default: unlabelled)

  • --lower_case (bool) – Whether to lower case all sentences. If doing mlm, very important to check whether classified data is lowercased (default: False)

class mlm.data_utils.prep_scrape.RawScrapePreprocessing(args: Namespace)

Class to preprocess raw data to MLM format from municipality scraped data.

Parametre:

args (argparse.Namespace) – input arguments from DataPrepArgParser.

Eksempel:
from mlm.data_utils.data_prep_input_args import DataPrepArgParser
from mlm.data_utils.prep_scrape import RawScrapePreprocessing
prep_parser = DataPrepArgParser()
prep_args = prep_parser.parser.parse_args()
data_preprocessor = RawScrapePreprocessing(args=prep_args)
data_preprocessor.run()
CLI eksempel:
python -m mlm.data_utils.prep_scrape

Metoder

run()

Generate train and validation data as json line files from raw scrape file. Calls class methods:

  • extract_danish_and_save_from_raw()

  • create_unique_sentences()

  • split_train_val()

extract_danish_and_save_from_raw()

Filters each raw scrape file, keeps line id and page_filtered_text where danish is detected and writes to json line file filtered_scrape/<source_name>_filtered.

create_unique_sentences(out_file_name: str = 'unique_sentences.jsonl')

Split all approved text blocks to sentences with self.sentence_splitter. Calls create_dump_data and helper function split_sentences.

Parametre:

out_file_name (str) – json out file name

split_train_val(in_file: str = 'unique_sentences.jsonl', seed: int = 42)

Split approved sentences to train and validation set and call save_datasets().

Parametre:

  • in_file ((str, Optional)) – jsonlines file

  • seed ((int, Optional)) – seed for reproducibility

create_dump_data(data: dict, sentence_counter: int, sentence: str, seen: set, filename: str, model, tokenizer, class_data: set) → Tuple[dict | None, set]

Return dump data if data passes quality check and is not in classified data used for Sequence Classification.

Parametre:

  • data (dict) – dictionary of input data

  • sentence_counter (int) – Sentence number of input url

  • sentence (str) – sentence

  • seen (set) – whether the sentence has been seen before - we only need unique sentences

  • filename (str) – Input filename

  • model (AutoModelWithLMHead or None) – GPT model needed for perplexity

  • tokenizer (AutoTokenizer or None) – Tokenizer needed for perplexity

  • class_data (set) – Classified data used for Sequence Classification

Returnerer:

If sentence pass quality check, return Tuple with data for modelling and updated set of seen observations, else (None, seen)

Returtype:

Tuple[Optional[dict], set]

save_datasets(train: List[dict] | None = None, val: List[dict] | None = None, train_outfile: str | None = None)

Take train and validation data as input and saves to json-lines files compatible with torch dataset.

Parametre:

  • train (List[dict], Optional) – List[str] where each element is a valid sentence for training

  • val (List[dict], Optional) – List[str] where each element is a valid sentence for validation

  • train_outfile (str, Optional) – name of train file

static is_correct_danish(data_dict: dict, confidence_threshold: int)

Detect correct danish text without raw html code

Parametre:

  • data_dict (dict) – raw text from scraped url

  • confidence_threshold (int) – confidence in which we filter danish prediction

Returnerer:

Whether data is determined as danish

Returtype:

bool

static fix_utf8_encodings(data_dict: dict) → dict

Use fix_encoding and manually replace wrong danish letters.

Parametre:

data (dict) – text and metadata from scraped url

Returnerer:

data updated with correct encoded text

Returtype:

dict

class sc.data_utils.prep_scrape.ClassifiedScrapePreprocessing(args: Namespace)

Class for reading raw excel file with classified KL categories and split to train and validation data.

Parametre:

args (argparse.Namespace) – input arguments from DataPrepArgParser.

Eksempel:
from mlm.data_utils.data_prep_input_args import DataPrepArgParser
from sc.data_utils.prep_scrape import ClassifiedScrapePreprocessing
prep_parser = DataPrepArgParser()
prep_args = prep_parser.parser.parse_args()
prep_args.data_type = 'labelled'
data_preprocessor = ClassifiedScrapePreprocessing(args=prep_args)
concat_data = data_preprocessor.concat_all_classified_data()
grouped_data = data_preprocessor.group_data_by_class(
    list_data=concat_data)
data_preprocessor.train_val_test_to_json_split(
    class_grouped_data=grouped_data,
    train_outfile='train_classified',
    val_outfile='eval_classified',
    test_outfile='test_classified',
    train_size=0.9,
    test_size=30)
CLI eksempel:
python -m sc.data_utils.prep_scrape --data_type labelled

Metoder

read_xls_save_json(file_dir: str = '/home/kasper/code/ai-sig/modelling/docs/sc/data/classified_data', ppl_filters: List[int] | None = None, drop_na: bool = True)

Read excel file with labelled data and save to json lines file

Parametre:

  • file_dir (str) – directory to read file from

  • ppl_filters – filter data on perplexity scores

  • drop_na – drop not classified sentences

class ner.data_utils.prep_data.NERDataPreprocessing(args: Namespace)

Class to prepare data for NER training.

Parametre:

args (argparse.Namespace) – input arguments from :class: .DataPrepArgParser.

static create_bilou(args)

Creates bilou file from raw file.

Parametre:

args (argparse.Namespace) – input arguments from :class: .DataPrepArgParser.

Hjælpefunktioner

mlm.data_utils.helpers.split_sentences(filename: str, sentence_splitter: object, disapproved_sentences: List[str]) → Tuple[List[str], List[str]]

Takes raw html input text and splits to sentences

Parametre:

  • data_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing raw input text from filtered scrape file

  • filename (str) – filename

  • sentence_splitter (PunktSentenceTokenizer) – Tokenizer to split sentences

  • disapproved_sentences (List[str]) – list of disapproved sentences

Returnerer:

List of sentences, list of disapproved sentences

Returtype:

Tuple[List[str], List[str]]
